Question.TranslatedText: Section One: General Information - How old are you?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: How old are you?
OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:ItemSubHeader: We’d like to start by asking you some general questions about yourself:

Question.TranslatedText: What is your gender?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: What is your gender?

Question.TranslatedText: What is your race?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: What is your race?

Question.TranslatedText: What is your ethnicity?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: What is your ethnicity?

ItemDef.Name: PARTNER
ItemDef.Comment: Are you married or living with a partner?

Question.TranslatedText: Are you married or living with a partner?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: Are you married or living with a partner?

Question.TranslatedText: If no, are you:

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: If no, are you:

Question.TranslatedText: How tall are you?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: How tall are you?

Question.TranslatedText: How much do you weigh?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: How much do you weigh?

Question.TranslatedText: Did you graduate from high school?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: Did you graduate from high school?

Question.TranslatedText:
Section Two: Literacy - Now, I'd like to check your ability to read and understand the things doctors often give patients, like medical instructions. Many people have a hard time understanding medical instructions, and this can affect your health. Do you wear glasses? (IF YES…) Please put them on. I am going to show you some medical instructions that you might see around a hospital. There are words missing in these instructions, like in this example (HAND EXAMPLE). I want you to fill in the missing words. Just below the blank line, we've listed 4 possible words to complete the sentence. Choose the word that makes the most sense. Ex. Your blood test was _________. a. normal b. take c. hurt d. germs So, in this example, "Your blood test was ________", the word "normal" is the only word that can complete the sentence so it makes sense. Is that clear? You will have 7 minutes to do this. Just complete as much as you can in that time. Ready? You can start.
Your doctor has sent you to have a __________ X-ray.

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText:
Now, I'd like to check your ability to read and understand the things doctors often give patients, like medical instructions. Many people have a hard time understanding medical instructions, and this can affect your health. Do you wear glasses? (IF YES…) Please put them on. I am going to show you some medical instructions that you might see around a hospital. There are words missing in these instructions, like in this example (HAND EXAMPLE). I want you to fill in the missing words. Just below the blank line, we've listed 4 possible words to complete the sentence. Choose the word that makes the most sense. Ex. Your blood test was _________. a. normal b. take c. hurt d. germs So, in this example, "Your blood test was ________", the word "normal" is the only word that can complete the sentence so it makes sense. Is that clear? You will have 7 minutes to do this. Just complete as much as you can in that time. Ready? You can start.
Your doctor has sent you to have a __________ X-ray.

Question.TranslatedText: You must have an _________ stomach when you come for _______.

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: You must have an _________ stomach when you come for _______.

Question.TranslatedText: The X-ray will ________ from 1 to 3 _________ to do.

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: The X-ray will ________ from 1 to 3 _________ to do.

Question.TranslatedText: For supper have only a ________snack of fruit, __________ and jelly, with coffee or tea.

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: For supper have only a ________snack of fruit, __________ and jelly, with coffee or tea.

Question.TranslatedText: After _____________, you must not _______ or drink

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: After _____________, you must not _______ or drink

Question.TranslatedText: anything at __________ until after you have __________ the X-ray.

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: anything at __________ until after you have __________ the X-ray.

Question.TranslatedText: I agree to give correct information to ____________ if I can receive Medicaid.

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: I agree to give correct information to ____________ if I can receive Medicaid.

Question.TranslatedText: I _________ to provide the county information to ______________ any

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: I _________ to provide the county information to ______________ any

Question.TranslatedText: statements given in this ___________________ and hereby give permission to

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: statements given in this ___________________ and hereby give permission to

Question.TranslatedText: the ___________________ to get such proof. I _____________ that for

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: the ___________________ to get such proof. I _____________ that for

Question.TranslatedText: Medicaid I must report any ________________ in my circumstances

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: Medicaid I must report any ________________ in my circumstances

Question.TranslatedText: within ___________ (10) days of becoming _________ of the change.

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: within ___________ (10) days of becoming _________ of the change.

Question.TranslatedText: I understand ___________ if I DO NOT like the ___________ made on my

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: I understand ___________ if I DO NOT like the ___________ made on my

Question.TranslatedText: case, I have the ___________ to a fair hearing. I can ____________ a

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: case, I have the ___________ to a fair hearing. I can ____________ a

Question.TranslatedText: hearing by writing or __________ the county where I applied.

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: hearing by writing or __________ the county where I applied.

Question.TranslatedText: If you ____________ AFDC/Welfare for any family ______________, you will have to

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: If you ____________ AFDC/Welfare for any family ______________, you will have to

Question.TranslatedText: _______________ a different application form. ____________________, we will use

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: _______________ a different application form. ____________________, we will use

Question.TranslatedText: the _____________ on this form to determine your ____________________.

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: the _____________ on this form to determine your ____________________.

ItemDef.Name: RATE_HEALTH
ItemDef.Comment: Overall, how would you rate your health?

Question.TranslatedText: Section Three: Health - Overall, how would you rate your health?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: Overall, how would you rate your health?
OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:ItemSubHeader: Now, we’d like to ask you some questions about your health:

Question.TranslatedText: Do you smoke?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: Do you smoke?

ItemDef.Name: DRINKS
ItemDef.Comment: On average, how many days per week do you drink alcohol such as beer, wine, or liquor?

Question.TranslatedText: On average, how many days per week do you drink alcohol such as beer, wine, or liquor?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: On average, how many days per week do you drink alcohol such as beer, wine, or liquor?

ItemDef.Name: DENTIST
ItemDef.Comment: Has it been longer than one year since you have seen a dentist?

Question.TranslatedText: Has it been longer than one year since you have seen a dentist?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: Has it been longer than one year since you have seen a dentist?

ItemDef.Name: PAIN_MOUTH
ItemDef.Comment: Do you have any pain in your mouth?

Question.TranslatedText: Do you have any pain in your mouth?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: Do you have any pain in your mouth?

ItemDef.Name: GUM_BLEED
ItemDef.Comment: Do your gums bleed when you brush your teeth?

Question.TranslatedText: Do your gums bleed when you brush your teeth?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: Do your gums bleed when you brush your teeth?

ItemDef.Name: SAD
ItemDef.Comment: In the last two weeks, have you had little interest or pleasure in doing things?

Question.TranslatedText: In the last two weeks, have you had little interest or pleasure in doing things?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: In the last two weeks, have you had little interest or pleasure in doing things?

ItemDef.Name: INTEREST
ItemDef.Comment: In the last two weeks, have you been feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?

Question.TranslatedText: In the last two weeks, have you been feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: In the last two weeks, have you been feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?

Question.TranslatedText: How many sexual partners have you had in the last year?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: How many sexual partners have you had in the last year?

ItemDef.Name: TYPICAL_DRINK
ItemDef.Comment: On a typical day when you drink, how many drinks do you have? A drink is defined as one 12 oz bottle of beer or wine cooler, a 5 oz glass of wine, or 1.5 ounces of distilled spirits.

Question.TranslatedText: Section Four - On a typical day when you drink, how many drinks do you have? A drink is defined as one 12 oz bottle of beer or wine cooler, a 5 oz glass of wine, or 1.5 ounces of distilled spirits.

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: On a typical day when you drink, how many drinks do you have? A drink is defined as one 12 oz bottle of beer or wine cooler, a 5 oz glass of wine, or 1.5 ounces of distilled spirits.

ItemDef.Name: MAXIMUM_DRINKS
ItemDef.Comment: What is the maximum number of drinks you had on any given day in the past month?

OpenClinica:ItemPresentInForm.OpenClinica:LeftItemText: What is the maximum number of drinks you had on any given day in the past month?

OpenClinica:StudyParameterList.Name: When Performing Data Entry, Interviewer Name Required For Data Entry
When Performing Data Entry, Interviewer Name Default as Blank
When Performing Data Entry, Interviewer Name Editable
When Performing Data Entry, Interview Date Required
When Performing Data Entry, Interview Date Default as Blank
When Performing Data Entry, Interview Date Editable
Show Person ID on CRF Header
Forced Reason For Change in Administrative Editing

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: SD
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: I_CPCS_LOW_ENRGY + I_CPCS_APPETITE + I_CPCS_SLEEP + I_CPCS_HOPELESS + I_CPCS_SUICIDE + I_CPCS_PLEASURE + I_CPCS_FEEL_BAD +I_CPCS_CONCENTRATION +I_CPCS_SLOW + I_CPCS_PHQ_FINAL gt 200

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: MALE_AGE
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: IG_CPCS_INITIAL_QUESTIONS.I_CPCS_AGE gte 50 and IG_CPCS_INITIAL_QUESTIONS.I_CPCS_GENDER eq 10 or (I_CPCS_SMOKE eq 10 or IG_CPCS_INITIAL_QUESTIONS.I_CPCS_BODY_MASS_INDEX gte 30)

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: AHL
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: (I_CPCS_LIT1 +I_CPCS_LIT2 + I_CPCS_LIT2A + I_CPCS_LIT3 +I_CPCS_LIT3A +I_CPCS_LIT4 +I_CPCS_LIT4A + I_CPCS_LIT5 +I_CPCS_LIT5A +I_CPCS_LIT6 +I_CPCS_LIT6A + I_CPCS_LIT7 + I_CPCS_LIT8 + I_CPCS_LIT8A + I_CPCS_LIT9 + I_CPCS_LIT9A + I_CPCS_LIT10 + I_CPCS_LIT11 + I_CPCS_LIT11A + I_CPCS_LIT12 + I_CPCS_LIT13 + I_CPCS_LIT13A + I_CPCS_LIT14 + I_CPCS_LIT15 + I_CPCS_LIT15A + I_CPCS_LIT16 + I_CPCS_LIT16A + I_CPCS_LIT17 + I_CPCS_LIT17A +I_CPCS_LIT18 + I_CPCS_LIT19 + I_CPCS_LIT19A + I_CPCS_LIT20 + I_CPCS_LIT20A + I_CPCS_LIT21 + I_CPCS_LIT21A) gte 230

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: MD
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: (I_CPCS_LOW_ENRGY + I_CPCS_APPETITE + I_CPCS_SLEEP + I_CPCS_HOPELESS + I_CPCS_SUICIDE + I_CPCS_PLEASURE + I_CPCS_FEEL_BAD +I_CPCS_CONCENTRATION +I_CPCS_SLOW + I_CPCS_PHQ_FINAL) gte 50 and (I_CPCS_LOW_ENRGY + I_CPCS_APPETITE + I_CPCS_SLEEP + I_CPCS_HOPELESS + I_CPCS_SUICIDE + I_CPCS_PLEASURE + I_CPCS_FEEL_BAD +I_CPCS_CONCENTRATION +I_CPCS_SLOW + I_CPCS_PHQ_FINAL) lt 100

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: MOD
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: (I_CPCS_LOW_ENRGY + I_CPCS_APPETITE + I_CPCS_SLEEP + I_CPCS_HOPELESS + I_CPCS_SUICIDE + I_CPCS_PLEASURE + I_CPCS_FEEL_BAD +I_CPCS_CONCENTRATION +I_CPCS_SLOW + I_CPCS_PHQ_FINAL) gte 100 and (I_CPCS_LOW_ENRGY + I_CPCS_APPETITE + I_CPCS_SLEEP + I_CPCS_HOPELESS + I_CPCS_SUICIDE + I_CPCS_PLEASURE + I_CPCS_FEEL_BAD +I_CPCS_CONCENTRATION +I_CPCS_SLOW + I_CPCS_PHQ_FINAL) lt 150

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: MHL
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: (I_CPCS_LIT1 + I_CPCS_LIT2 + I_CPCS_LIT2A + I_CPCS_LIT3 + I_CPCS_LIT3A + I_CPCS_LIT4 + I_CPCS_LIT4A + I_CPCS_LIT5 + I_CPCS_LIT5A + I_CPCS_LIT6 + I_CPCS_LIT6A + I_CPCS_LIT7 + I_CPCS_LIT8 + I_CPCS_LIT8A + I_CPCS_LIT9 + I_CPCS_LIT9A + I_CPCS_LIT10 + I_CPCS_LIT11 + I_CPCS_LIT11A + I_CPCS_LIT12 + I_CPCS_LIT13 + I_CPCS_LIT14 + I_CPCS_LIT15 + I_CPCS_LIT15A + I_CPCS_LIT16 + I_CPCS_LIT16A + I_CPCS_LIT17 + I_CPCS_LIT17A + I_CPCS_LIT18 + I_CPCS_LIT19 + I_CPCS_LIT19A + I_CPCS_LIT20 + I_CPCS_LIT20A + I_CPCS_LIT21 + I_CPCS_LIT21A) gte 170 and (I_CPCS_LIT1 + I_CPCS_LIT2 + I_CPCS_LIT2A + I_CPCS_LIT3 + I_CPCS_LIT3A + I_CPCS_LIT4 + I_CPCS_LIT4A + I_CPCS_LIT5 + I_CPCS_LIT5A + I_CPCS_LIT6 + I_CPCS_LIT6A + I_CPCS_LIT7 + I_CPCS_LIT8 + I_CPCS_LIT9 + I_CPCS_LIT9A + I_CPCS_LIT10 + I_CPCS_LIT11 + I_CPCS_LIT11A + I_CPCS_LIT12 + I_CPCS_LIT13 + I_CPCS_LIT13A +I_CPCS_LIT14 + I_CPCS_LIT15 + I_CPCS_LIT15A + I_CPCS_LIT16 + I_CPCS_LIT16A + I_CPCS_LIT17 + I_CPCS_LIT17A + I_CPCS_LIT18 + I_CPCS_LIT19 + I_CPCS_LIT19A + I_CPCS_LIT20 + I_CPCS_LIT20A + I_CPCS_LIT21 +I_CPCS_LIT21A) lt 230

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: DENTAL
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: I_CPCS_DENTIST eq 10 or I_CPCS_PAIN_MOUTH eq 10 or I_CPCS_GUM_BLEED eq 10

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: BNQ
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: I_CPCS_ENOUGH_FOOD eq 10 or I_CPCS_LOSE_HOUSE eq 10 or I_CPCS_MONEY_HEAT eq 10

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: MSD
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: (I_CPCS_LOW_ENRGY + I_CPCS_APPETITE + I_CPCS_SLEEP + I_CPCS_HOPELESS + I_CPCS_SUICIDE + I_CPCS_PLEASURE + I_CPCS_FEEL_BAD +I_CPCS_CONCENTRATION +I_CPCS_SLOW + I_CPCS_PHQ_FINAL) gte 150 and (I_CPCS_LOW_ENRGY + I_CPCS_APPETITE + I_CPCS_SLEEP + I_CPCS_HOPELESS + I_CPCS_SUICIDE + I_CPCS_PLEASURE + I_CPCS_FEEL_BAD +I_CPCS_CONCENTRATION +I_CPCS_SLOW + I_CPCS_PHQ_FINAL) lt 200

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: FEMALE_AGE
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: IG_CPCS_INITIAL_QUESTIONS.I_CPCS_AGE gte 60 and IG_CPCS_INITIAL_QUESTIONS.I_CPCS_GENDER eq 20 and (I_CPCS_SMOKE eq 10 or IG_CPCS_INITIAL_QUESTIONS.I_CPCS_BODY_MASS_INDEX gte 30)

OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.Name: IHL
OpenClinicaRules:RuleDef.OpenClinicaRules:Expression: (I_CPCS_LIT1 +I_CPCS_LIT2 + I_CPCS_LIT2A + I_CPCS_LIT3 +I_CPCS_LIT3A +I_CPCS_LIT4 +I_CPCS_LIT4A + I_CPCS_LIT5 +I_CPCS_LIT5A +I_CPCS_LIT6 +I_CPCS_LIT6A + I_CPCS_LIT7 + I_CPCS_LIT8 + I_CPCS_LIT8A + I_CPCS_LIT9 + I_CPCS_LIT9A + I_CPCS_LIT10 + I_CPCS_LIT11 + I_CPCS_LIT11A + I_CPCS_LIT12 + I_CPCS_LIT13 + I_CPCS_LIT13A + I_CPCS_LIT14 + I_CPCS_LIT15 + I_CPCS_LIT15A + I_CPCS_LIT16 + I_CPCS_LIT16A + I_CPCS_LIT17 + I_CPCS_LIT17A +I_CPCS_LIT18 + I_CPCS_LIT19 + I_CPCS_LIT19A + I_CPCS_LIT20 + I_CPCS_LIT20A + I_CPCS_LIT21 + I_CPCS_LIT21A) lt 170
